titlestmt.subtitle: An inventory of the collection at Syracuse University

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: Alan Rafkin was an American television producer and director, primarily of situation comedies. Collection includes television scripts (ca. 750), videocassettes (ca. 200), and memorabilia.

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: Alan Rafkin is an alumnus of Syracuse University and one of the most talented directors of television sitcoms. His career, spanning over forty years, has included such shows as The Andy Griffith Show, The Dick Van Dyke Show, M*A*S*H, Coach and Suddenly Susan among many others. Rafkin won an Emmy Award in 1982 for directing One Day at a Time and in 1998 he wrote his autobiography entitled, Cue The Bunny On The Rainbow: Tales From TV's Most Prolific Sitcom Director.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p: The Alan Rafkin Papers is divided into scripts, videos and memorabilia. Scripts contains more than 700 scripts from television shows, mostly situation comedies; shows represented include Alice, The Bob Newhart Show, Charles in Charge, Coach, The Governor and J.J., It's Gary Shandling's Show, Laverne and Shirley, Love American Style, The Love Boat, Me & the Chimp, One Day At a Time, Sanford and Son, and Viva Valdez. Videos contains nearly 200 recordings of television shows, most of which are those represented in the scripts series. Videotapes are in one of three formats: VHS, Beta, U-matic. The format for each tape is given in parenthesis. Memorabilia comprises 2 boxes of miscellaneous memorabilia.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: Scripts and Videos are arranged alphabetically by title and within that in order by catalog number. Memorabilia is unprocessed and remains as received by &scrc_name;.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: &scrc_name; has a number of television-related collections. Please refer to &subjindex; for a complete listing

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The majority of our archival and manuscript collections are housed offsite and require advanced notice for retrieval. Researchers are encouraged to contact us in advance concerning the collection material they wish to access for their research.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Written permission must be obtained from SCRC and all relevant rights holders before publishing quotations, excerpts or images from any materials in this collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:
